intro: Calyptranthes quinoensis, commonly known as the Quino calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, often in coastal or mountainous regions. It produces small, dark berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
